catalysts.thesis: Irrational selloff following Q4 earnings has created a deep value opportunity, especially given the massive FY26 guidance beat ($2.75 EPS vs $2.22 est) which implies significant undervaluation.
catalysts.catalyst_details: Q4 Earnings Beat and FY26 Guidance Raise (EPS $2.75 vs $2.22 est) reported Feb 10.
catalysts.absorption_status: Rebounding from irrational 15% selloff; Valuation re-rating underway as dust settles.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Stock fell 15% despite beating Q4 estimates and raising FY26 guidance by ~24%.

catalysts.thesis: Market is focusing on a backward-looking Q4 earnings miss while ignoring a massive FY26 guidance raise where management doubled EPS expectations ($0.88-$0.92 vs $0.43 est).
catalysts.catalyst_details: Reported Q4 earnings Feb 12 with FY26 EPS guidance of $0.88-$0.92, significantly beating the consensus of $0.43.
catalysts.absorption_status: Price suppressed/flat as market absorbs Q4 headline miss, ignoring the forward-looking guidance beat.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Stock is trading near pre-earnings levels despite a 100% increase in forward EPS guidance.
catalysts.x_sentiment: Mixed (Retail confusion on miss vs guide)

catalysts.thesis: High-conviction insider buying from the COO ($2.75M purchase) signals confidence in dividend sustainability and NAV stability despite broader BDC sector headwinds.
catalysts.catalyst_details: COO M. Grier Eliasek purchased ~942,000 shares (approx. $2.75M value) on Feb 11.
catalysts.absorption_status: Stock price stable/consolidating near lows; Insider buy likely to trigger income-seeking flow.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Stock yields ~18% with significant insider accumulation at these levels, suggesting market fears are overblown.
